paragraphs.text: Unless they’re motivated purely by money (which almost nobody is), people work harder when they feel cared for. If you want someone to feel cared for, don’t ask “how can I get them to work 80 hours a week?”

paragraphs.name: 35ff
paragraphs.text: I recently read an article by Brian Knapp dismantling the idea that there’s a benefit to getting programmers to work more than 40 hours a week. The gist is that as the hours worked increase, so does burnout. Since there’s probably not enough work to fill more than 40 productive hours a week, what you get is a bunch of unhappy employees who try their best to look busy while quietly resenting the company they work for.

paragraphs.name: 35ff

Since there’s probably not enough work to fill more than 40 productive hours a week, what you get is a bunch of unhappy employees who try their best to look busy while quietly resenting the company they work for.

content.subtitle: In most cases, the 40 hour week is more productive because time and priorities are being managed wisely. It’s the great irony, more time …

paragraphs.name: 3fff
paragraphs.text: With an exception for the rare hackathon, any developer can tell the difference between a good 40 hour week and a bad 60 hour week.

paragraphs.name: b35c
paragraphs.text: In most cases, the 40 hour week is more productive because time and priorities are being managed wisely. It’s the great irony, more time = more waste and a higher percentage of waste.

virtuals.subtitle: 168 hours in a week. Take out 48 hours of the weekend. Take out 8 hours of sleep for the 5 weekdays. That actually leaves you with 80 hours…

content.subtitle: 168 hours in a week. Take out 48 hours of the weekend. Take out 8 hours of sleep for the 5 weekdays. That actually leaves you with 80 hours…

paragraphs.name: 87aa
paragraphs.text: Great article. One little issue:

168 hours in a week. Take out 48 hours of the weekend. Take out 8 hours of sleep for the 5 weekdays. That actually leaves you with 80 hours. Take out 80 hours of work, and you leave your employees with 0 hours over the 5 weekdays. Congratulations, your company is dead.

4f944d6b0703.title: I’d say 20-30 hours behind the keyboard and about 8–12 hours admin/meetings/r&d time seems about…

paragraphs.name: 8c41
paragraphs.text: I’d say 20-30 hours behind the keyboard and about 8–12 hours admin/meetings/r&d time seems about right. Honestly, I get my best work done behind the keyboard in about 20 hours of the week. Between 20 and 30 hours I’m at about 80% efficiency. Anything more than that, like you said, is just trying to force it and can actually be counterproductive. Can…
